intro: Machaerium dimorphandrum, commonly known as the two-form grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a perennial grass with slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately compound, contributing to its ornamental appeal in gardens. Machaerium dimorphandrum is often used in landscaping for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its drought tolerance.
